title: "Blood of Dracula" Art Deco sans serif
content:
Any ideas? It seems they replaced "U" by "V", or is the whole font a custom font?   
   
Thanks!   
   
 ![warhol](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707032743im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19899.jpg)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Well, it's not amongst the [Art Deco sans serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707032743/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=artdeco%2Bsansserif) at MyFonts,   
and not in Rookledge's nor the FontBook neither.

well, I suppose it's a custom made font then.   
I had checked the Fontbook too, asked around and was pointed to this forum. When I saw Mr Coles' and your name as moderators, I thought I'd surely get an answer here.   
   
Yves, little question...   
is there a reason why you changed the subjectname? (Did I use characters that aren't allowed?) Just so I don't make the same mistake in future posts. Thanks.

_\> is there a reason why you changed the subjectname?_   
   
Nah, it's purely practical: that way I can identify   
specific threads without having to open them. This   
allows me to work faster. Your naming was already   
pretty clear, but sometimes we've got half a dozen   
of threads saying _"Please help me to identify this   
font"_ , which is not very practical (and quite redundant   
for posts on this board: it's not like we're swapping   
recipes here).   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707032743im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
   
_When I saw Mr Coles' and your name as moderators_   
   
Stephen I understand, but I haven't quite made a name   
for myself outside this board. What do you mean?   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707032743im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

1. I was confused at first, I thought you removed my question as I couldn't find it anymore. Luckily I started going through the list before flaming away.   
   
2. well, we kinda met years ago, at the A-Type1 conference in Antwerp (93? 94?). I pretty much spent the whole weekend in the Typelab there. Mario Beernaert (remember TV27) got me there, with a couple of other students. I don't think I really spoke to you back then, apart from maybe asking the odd Fontographer question or some printer problem. ;-)   
As a customer of FS Belgium and reader of various FS publications, I obviously recognised your name when I saw it here.   
   
voila. da's ook weer opgelost dan...

_\> before flaming away._   
Now THAT would have been a valid reason to remove   
your post. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707032743im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
   
_\> Mario Beernaert (remember TV27)_   
Of course I remember Mario. Cloaca Maxima was one of   
the good things happening those days, and I was _very_  
pleased he won the FUSE Contest. I was less happy   
with the outcome of the FontFont Contest though...
